narratives.narrative_name: URW: Blaming the war on others rather than the invader
narratives.evidence_quote: Sadly the western media is framing the war as if Russia is losing which only prolongs negotiations and causes more death. The question is, why the desperation to keep the war going?
narratives.reasoning: This quote shifts blame for the prolongation of the war and resulting deaths onto Western media and implied Western actions, rather than attributing responsibility to Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

narratives.evidence_quote: amerika always blew any comment about RUSSIA or at later stages CHINA way out of proportion.. and you are still doing …for me …,a poor western subject.. I have NEVER agreed with you..in fact you have NEVER asked me my thoughts ….oh sorry I was / am just your cannon fodder …I do not count…
narratives.reasoning: This quote criticizes Western governments and policies, portraying them as dismissive, manipulative, and indifferent to their citizens, which aligns with discrediting the West.

narratives.evidence_quote: amerikans are the greatest pigs on the planet…and that is in the most derogitive term you can imagine.. absolute pigs
narratives.reasoning: The language used here is explicitly derogatory and aims to undermine the moral character and legitimacy of Americans and, by extension, Western nations.

narratives.narrative_name: URW: Negative Consequences for the West
narratives.evidence_quote: time they took responsibility (rather than consequences) of what their politicians are doing in their name..
narratives.reasoning: This quote implies that Western populations will face negative consequences due to the actions of their politicians, highlighting adverse outcomes for the West.

narratives.evidence_quote: Sadly the western media is framing the war as if Russia is losing which only prolongs negotiations and causes more death... information that you are missing from the corporation propaganda western media
narratives.reasoning: This quote explicitly questions the reliability and integrity of Western media, labeling it as propaganda and suggesting it misleads the public.

narratives.evidence_quote: Will they resort to nuclear weapons to even out the war?... lets get on with a full nuke war…wipe us all out …at least it (for most) will be over quickly
narratives.reasoning: These quotes evoke fear and anxiety about the potential for nuclear war, amplifying the perceived threat and danger associated with the conflict.
This statement positively highlights Russia's position in the conflict, framing it as successful and dominant, which aligns with the praise of Russia narrative.

narratives.evidence_quote: for the west it’s always been the soviet (RUSSIAN) that has ALWAYS been the boogie man..when in fact they were SELDOM a threat
narratives.reasoning: This quote portrays Russia as unfairly targeted and victimized by the West, framing it as a historical pattern of unjust blame and fearmongering.

subnarratives.subnarrative_name: URW: Blaming the war on others rather than the invader: The West are the aggressors
subnarratives.evidence_quote: for the west it’s always been the soviet (RUSSIAN) that has ALWAYS been the boogie man..when in fact they were SELDOM a threat.. amerika always blew any comment about RUSSIA or at later stages CHINA way out of proportion.. and you are still doing …for me …,a poor western subject..
subnarratives.reasoning: This quote explicitly shifts blame for the conflict onto the West, portraying them as the ones exaggerating threats and perpetuating hostility, rather than acknowledging Russia's role as the invader.

subnarratives.subnarrative_name: URW: Blaming the war on others rather than the invader: Other
subnarratives.evidence_quote: time to stop caring about the people that do not care..they are the enemy of one sort or the other.. time they took responsibility (rather than consequences) of what their politicians are doing in their name.. Scott Ritter ..good topics ..talking the truth..yes but where is what he says getting us …seems nowhere ..lets get on with a full nuke war…wipe us all out …at least it (for most) will be over quickly and no more of month after month of promises from Trump or threats from the east….POOF..it’s all over …thanks mostly to un-elected bureaucrats in all “western countries” they are proving the worst of the worst of humanity
subnarratives.reasoning: This segment supports the parent narrative by blaming Western bureaucrats and politicians for prolonging the war and escalating tensions, without directly attributing responsibility to Russia. It frames the West as the primary culprit for the conflict's continuation and potential catastrophic outcomes, which does not fit the specific subnarratives but aligns with the broader theme of deflecting blame from the invader.

subnarratives.subnarrative_name: URW: Discrediting the West, Diplomacy: The West is weak

subnarratives.reasoning: The title and framing of the interview suggest that the West's position is deteriorating, portraying it as desperate and thus weak in the face of Russia's actions.

subnarratives.subnarrative_name: URW: Amplifying war-related fears: There is a real possibility that nuclear weapons will be employed
subnarratives.evidence_quote: Will they resort to nuclear weapons to even out the war? ... lets get on with a full nuke war…wipe us all out …at least it (for most) will be over quickly
subnarratives.reasoning: The text explicitly raises the specter of nuclear weapons being used, evoking fear and anxiety about their potential employment. The phrase 'full nuke war' and the discussion of its catastrophic consequences directly align with the subnarrative's definition.

subnarratives.subnarrative_name: URW: Amplifying war-related fears: By continuing the war we risk WWIII
subnarratives.evidence_quote: time to stop caring about the people that do not care..they are the enemy of one sort or the other.. time they took responsibility (rather than consequences) of what their politicians are doing in their name.. Scott Ritter ..good topics ..talking the truth..yes but where is what he says getting us …seems nowhere ..lets get on with a full nuke war…wipe us all out
subnarratives.reasoning: The text implies that the continuation of the war and the actions of Western governments could lead to a catastrophic global conflict (e.g., 'full nuke war'). This evokes fear of escalation to WWIII, fitting the subnarrative's definition of warning against upsetting Russia and risking broader conflict.
